{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with sudden severe left leg pain and tingling, along with a pale and cool left leg. The popliteal pulse is weaker on the left side compared to the right side. These findings suggest acute arterial occlusion. The most common cause of acute arterial occlusion is arterial emboli, which can occur due to cardiac sources such as atrial fibrillation or valvular disease. Vasculitis, hyperhomocysteinemia, and arterial trauma are less common causes of acute arterial occlusion.", "answer_choice": "C. Arterial emboli"}
